author: Louisa Carter
method: Place the chicken in a saucepan, add just enough boiling water to cover, then bring to the boil and simmer for 8-10 minutes, or until opaque and cooked through. Remove from the water and set aside on a plate to cool, reserve the cooking liquor. When cool enough to handle, shred the chicken. Meanwhile, soak the breadcrumbs in the milk. Heat the oil in a large frying pan over a medium-high heat and fry the onion for 7-8 minutes, or until softened and golden. Add the garlic and chilli and fry for a further minute until fragrant. Stir in the paprika, turmeric and seasoning and fry for a minute, adding a little more oil if the mixture looks dry. Add the shredded chicken and stir to coat in the spices for a minute, then pour in the soaked breadcrumbs and milk. Add 200ml of the reserved stock, bring to a boil then lower the heat and simmer gently for five minutes. Stir in the nuts and simmer for a further 5 minutes, or until the sauce is rich and creamy, adding a little more stock if it gets too thick. Stir in the parmesan, season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
ingredients: 2 chicken breasts,  50g fresh white breadcrumbs,  200ml whole milk,  2-3 tbsp olive oil or vegetable oil,  1 large onion, chopped,  3 cloves garlic, chopped,  1 large mild green chilli, seeds removed, finely chopped,  1 tsp paprika,  Â¼ tsp turmeric,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  35g ground walnuts,  20g grated parmesan
